ThingDef.label: dewback
ThingDef.description: Dewbacks are large, four-legged, omnivorous, cold-blooded reptiles native to the Dune Sea of Tatooine. As such, they are well-adapted to the harsh desert climate. This and the fact that they can be easily domesticated make them commonly employed as beasts of burden by both the inhabitants of the desert planet and the off-worlders wandering its dunes. Due to their numerous useful traits and versatility, they are quite possibly the most respected of all the creatures native to Tatooine.

ThingDef.label: Rancor
ThingDef.description: Rancors were large carnivorous reptomammals native to the planet of Dathomir. Standing around five meters tall, with their long arms, immense jaws, and armored hides that could withstand blaster fire, they are formidable predators. A subspecies known as the jungle rancor populates the planets Felucia and Teth.

ThingDef.label: bantha
ThingDef.description: Banthas are a species of large, hairy mammals with sharp, spiraling horns. They inhabit the desert planet Tatooine, though they are bred on many worlds throughout the galaxy. They are social herd animals, and are often domesticated, and used prominently, by Tusken Raiders as mounts and companionship.

ThingDef.label: nexu
ThingDef.description: Nexu's are agile predators with four red eyes and sharp quills. They have infrared vision and are 4.51 meters long. Typically 0.94 meters tall, nexus possess sharp teeth and claws, as well as long tails. It's light build allows it to remain highly agile and difficult to hit.

ThingDef.label: acklay
ThingDef.description: The acklay is a non-sentient carnivore native to planet Vendaxa. Acklays have sharp claws, thick skin, and are about 3 meters tall. Due to these attributes, as well as the species' ferocity, acklays are often exported from Vendaxa to be used in gladiatorial combat. The creatures can be found on Geonosis, where they are commonly brought in to fight other creatures—and sentients—in the Petranaki arena.

ThingDef.label: tauntaun
ThingDef.description: Tauntauns are a species of omnivorous reptomammals who are indigenous to the icy planet of Hoth. Tauntauns were commonly used as pack animals during the Rebel Alliance's stay at Hoth. Tauntauns were also used as patrol mounts when it was learned that the Rebel Alliance's own vehicles could not cope with the very cold weather.

ThingDef.label: krayt dragon
ThingDef.description: Krayt dragons are large, carnivorous reptiles from Tatooine, a desert planet in the galaxy's Outer Rim Territories. They come in two subspecies and, despite their fierceness, are hunted for the precious pearls found in their bodies.

ThingDef.label: reek
ThingDef.description: Reeks are large, muscular quadrupeds native to the planet Ylesia. Their sprawling posture and immense weight make them relatively slow-moving. They sport two large cheek horns that can be used for head-locking in combat with another Reek as a show of dominance.

ThingDef.label: nerf
ThingDef.description: Nerfs were a species of furry, non-sentient animals raised for their milk, meat, and hide. They could be found on a variety of planets across the galaxy, from Alderaan to Lothal. Despite their usefulness, nerfs were often regarded as disgusting because of their strong body odor.

ThingDef.label: gizka
ThingDef.description: Whatever their native world, their extraordinary reproduction rate led to a fair amount of gizka on many worlds, even including uncharted planets such as Lehon, finding their way from the wreckage of crashed starships. It has been alternatively postulated that they came from that planet originally, spreading along with the Infinite Empire. Their exponential population growth led to them being considered pests on almost as many worlds as they inhabited, as they commonly ate electrical wiring. They were the source for the delicacy gizka steak.

ThingDef.label: porg
ThingDef.description: The Porg.

ThingDef.label: vulptex
ThingDef.description: Vulptices were a non-sentient species of omnivorous and gregarious canids from the mineral world Crait. They were distinguished by their coats made up of white crystalline bristles.

ThingDef.label: Wampa
ThingDef.description: wampa were a carnivorous, white-furred species which dwelled on the snow-clad planet Hoth.

ThingDef.label: akk
ThingDef.description: Akk (or sometimes called 'akk hounds'), were large reptomammals native to the planet Haruun Kal. Great companions, Akk matured from pups to hounds in a relatively short time and were often used for protection due to their likelihood to form strong bonds with their master. The illegal smuggling of these loyal but dangerous creatures has lead to them being found on many worlds.

ThingDef.label: aiwha
ThingDef.description: Aiwhas could be found on several worlds where they lived in medium-size "pods," feeding on fish and other small creatures found in or around huge bodies of water. Aiwhas are sometimes sold so as to be used as mounts on worlds that have a breathable atmosphere, and could be used for performing reconnaissance, or to traverse between two outposts without any concern for the trail or terrain.

ThingDef.label: anooba
ThingDef.description: Anoobas were aggressive pack predators that lived throughout the Outer Rim Territories. Opportunistic hunters as well as scavengers, these wolflike canines would attack virtually anything smaller than themselves (such as scurriers).

ThingDef.label: behemoth
ThingDef.description: The Behemoths (or 'Sith war behemoths') were beasts of war used by the Sith that originated from the frozen planet Khar Dhelba. Wild war behemoths tended to travel in small groups of two to four and spent most of their existence searching for food. They were omnivorous in the sense that they ate anything they were able to find. The Behemoths were spread to various worlds with the Sith armies, either escaping or let loose whehre they would revert back to their original feral forms.

ThingDef.label: beldon
ThingDef.description: Beldons were a large cnidaria species native to the gas giant Bespin. They lived in the planet's lower atmosphere and could be found in large herds. They used the long tendrils on their bodies to gather atmospheric plankton and chemicals and so require very little direct nutrition. This variety appears to have been engineered to not only survive away from Bespin, but create useful Chemfuel and are thus very combustible.

ThingDef.label: Boar-wolf
ThingDef.description: The boar-wolves (or 'Borra'), were a predatory animal that came from the forest moon of Endor. Boar-wolves were believed to be closer to wolves than boars physiologically speaking, and usually hunted for prey such as blurrgs. They could be trained as attack beasts and so have been exported to various worlds by criminal elements for such purposes.

ThingDef.label: blarth
ThingDef.description: Blarths were medium-sized predators native to the planet Naboo named for the low burping sound that it made. Amiable and easily tamed, they were kept as a household pet and watch animal by Gungans since prehistoric times. More recently the animals had made their way to off-world pet shops on worlds such as Coruscant.

ThingDef.label: blixus
ThingDef.description: Blixus were rare, half-shelled crustapod creatures native to the planet Sljee. These semi-aquatic predators were known to be deadly in the swamps and lagoons they inhabit. They were known to periodically shed their exoskeleton if broken or damaged which could be harvested for useful chitin. It is believed many were accidently transplanted to various worlds as exotic display animals or pets that grew too large to contain.

ThingDef.label: blurrg
ThingDef.description: Blurrgs were a two-legged non-sentient reptilian species that were used as beasts of burden on a number of worlds located across the galaxy. Blurrgs had two short arms that had two fingers with claws, and a thick tail that helped them balance. The creatures possessed large mouths and many sharp teeth that could chew through most materials, including grasses and weeds, though they were not strictly herbivores and were known to consume other organisms, even members of their own kind.

ThingDef.label: bolotaur
ThingDef.description: The Bolotaur are a large, long-necked herbivorous reptilian creatures native to the planet Kashyyyk. They were short-lived but reproduced quickly and were a favoured mount by the Trandoshan species, which resulted in their spread to many worlds as beasts of burden and livestock.

ThingDef.label: bogwing
ThingDef.description: The bogwing is a fast flying reptavian native to Dagobah. They could be found on a number of worlds located across the galaxy. They mostly fed on small creatures dwelling in the lower levels of tree canopies (including rodents like leaftails) to avoid larger predators.

ThingDef.label: boma
ThingDef.description: Bomas were ravenous beasts native to planet Onderon and its moon Dxun. In their native environment they hunted Cannoks with ease and were considered dangerous by several Mandalorian clans. They were sometimes introduced into ecosystems on other worlds where Cannoks had become established to help maintain their population.

ThingDef.label: bordok
ThingDef.description: The bordoks were a vaguely equine herbivore native to the forest moon of Endor. They were used on many worlds as pack animals when tamed. Bordoks were very sure-footed and, in spite of their size, capable of carrying large loads.

ThingDef.label: Borcatu
ThingDef.description: Borcatu were small, bad-tempered scavengers originally found on the planet of Escabar. Borcatu had a scaly, thick hide which may have evolved to help resist sandstorms. They also have sharp teeth and claws, which they used to burrow or to defend themselves. They had a vicious temperament, biting anyone who came near them, and often fighting and cannibalizing one another when no other food source was available. Their hardiness resulted in them spreading to various world as 'stowaways' and adapting quite successfully to a wide range of habitats.

ThingDef.label: brezak
ThingDef.description: Brezaks (also known as "Zygerrian gliding lizards"), were large carnivorous reptavians from the planet Zygerria. Their flat tail served as a rudder, and when controlled by a skilled rider, they were quite agile while in flight. Due to their prevalence within Zyggerian culture, these creatures were transplanted and established themselves on other worlds.

ThingDef.label: bursa
ThingDef.description: Bursas were a species of ursidae creatures native to planet of Naboo. They had tusked snouts and feathery tufts of brown hair on their thick-skinned bodies. They were popular as circus animals due to their intelligence, but more often than not this resulted in them escaping and forming wild populations on various temperate worlds.

ThingDef.label: can-cell
ThingDef.description: Can-cells were a species of scavenging flying insectoids found on a number of planets across the galaxy (although it is believed they originated on Kashyyk). Can-Cells evolved many of their strange physical characteristics to maximise their survival in the dangerous forests and jungles they inhabit.

ThingDef.label: cannok
ThingDef.description: Cannoks were small, aggressive predators native to the moon of Dxun. They had a habit of eating anything that could fit in their mouths and were known as pests, due to a high reproduction rate and notable curiosity. Cannoks were however hardy and able to survive the rigors of many worlds.

ThingDef.label: convor
ThingDef.description: Convor (also known as "Trandoshan birds"), were a species of beautiful mammavian from the Wasskah moon of Hsskhor. Although Convor had short, plump bodies, they were excellent fliers. Their popularity as a pet meant they often established colonies on other worlds.

ThingDef.label: corellian hound
ThingDef.description: Corellian hounds, also known as 'Sibian hounds' or 'Snarlers', were a type of stout canidae from the planet Corellia. They were quick and nimble canines used by locals for a number of tasks although they were often used for hunting and tracking. They had a vicious bark and bite, which meant they could be quite effective for protection.

ThingDef.label: corinathoth
ThingDef.description: Corinathoths were large, slow-moving herbivores native to the planet Maridun. Although large and intimidating, they were fairly harmless unless provoked. It is likely they were spread as a large game animal to several worlds due to their fearsome appearance.

ThingDef.label: dactillion
ThingDef.description: The dactillions were a reptavian native to the sinkhole world of Utapau. Dactillions shared both avian and lizard traits, with long, thin wings and thick, scaled hides. A dactillion's pair of wings allowed it to ride the thermal updrafts in a Utapau sinkhole, and its prominent limbs allowed it to scale the rocky side. An avian cousin of the speedy varactyl, the dactillion served as a mounts.

ThingDef.label: dalgo
ThingDef.description: Dalgos were equine reptiles native to the planet of Onderon. Despite being carnivorous predators, they could still be domesticated and filled the same role as other beasts of burden. It is for this reason these creatures found themselves spread across many worlds.

ThingDef.label: dianoga
ThingDef.description: Dianoga originated on the planet Vodran and were large cephalopods capable of growing to great sizes. They had a single eyestalk protruding from their mollusk-like bodies, and seven suckered tentacles surrounding a fanged maw containing a sharp serrated probe. Normally these creatures were restricted to bodies of water, but this variety seems just as comfortable dragging itself around on land.

ThingDef.label: drexl
ThingDef.description: Drexls (also known as 'warbeasts') were reptavian winged creatures indigenous to Onderonian moon of Dxun. In early stages of Onderon history, drexls were feared predators that spread terror, attacking the primitive Onderonian villages. The creatures were later trained as mounts by the Onderonian outcasts, who came to be known as 'Beast Riders'. Their viciousness as 'warbeasts' resulted in them being unintentionally spread to numerous worlds where they readily carved out an ecological niche.

ThingDef.label: energy spider
ThingDef.description: Energy spiders (or "spice spiders") were horrifying arachnids that inhabited the Spice Mines of Kessel. The webs that these creatures spin between their legs can be harvested as Glitterstim (a potent drug and medicinal ingredient). This variety of Energy Spider appears to have been bioengineered to survive off of Kessel but with the downside that they have massive appetites. They can however survive in extreme temperatures (both hot and cold) and they (or their product) are not aversed to the sunlight.

ThingDef.label: eopie
ThingDef.description: Eopies were a species of quadrupedal mammallian herbivores native to the planet Tatooine. These tough creatures were acclimated to their homeworld's endless deserts, and as a result were domesticated and exported offworld as pack animals. The eopie's rough skin helped to protect it against the heat while its hooves were adapted to climbing rocky cliffs.

ThingDef.label: falumpaset
ThingDef.description: The falumpaset were a large mammalalian creature native to the planet Naboo. Their distinctive bellowing calls could be heard for kilometers around and their intelligence made them likely to form strong bonds with their handlers. Easily domesticated as beasts of burden (or sometimes war mounts), falumpasets could be found all over the galaxy.

ThingDef.label: fambaa
ThingDef.description: Fambaas were large herbivorous amphibians most often found in swamps. Fambaas were technically amphibians but had the scaly hide of reptiles. The creatures size and usefulness when domesticated meant they were exported to many worlds as beasts of burden.

ThingDef.label: feral grazer
ThingDef.description: These slow-moving herbivorous mammalia were native to Alderaan. 'Feral' or 'wild' grazers were significantly leaner than the fatter and more well-fed domestic grazer; however both species were distantly related to Nerfs. Their horns, tough leathery hides and fat layers acted as an additional defense against predation.

ThingDef.label: feral nerf
ThingDef.description: Nerfs were a species of antlered, herbivorous mammalia found all across the galaxy. Because of the nerf's ability to easily adapt to harsh environments, several defined sub-species existed and were often referred to as 'feral' or 'wild' variants of the same animal.

ThingDef.label: frog dog
ThingDef.description: Frog-dogs were a species of reptillians with both frog-like and dog-like features. The creatures hopped and waddled from place to place. Frog-dog vocalizations sounded like throaty barks and croaks. Some have speculated as to the exact intelligence of a Frog Dog.

ThingDef.label: gelagrub
ThingDef.description: Gelagrubs, also known as 'Felucian ground beetles', were large insectine creatures native to Felucia. This variety (with some genetic tweaking) found themselves popular for export to many Rimworlds because they remained in their useful grub-like state for their entire lives whilst also swapping out their normal phosphorescence for neutroamine production.

ThingDef.label: gorg
ThingDef.description: Gorgs, known as 'chubas' in Huttese, were small precocious amphibians that could be found on several planets. They were popularly favored as food by many humanoid species. Thus they became popular livestock on sparse worlds due to their high temperature tolerance, minimal food consumption and fast breeding.

ThingDef.label: gornt
ThingDef.description: The gornt was a domesticated, omnivorous creature native on the world of Hethar. A naturally bred gornt would grow to a meter or more long and was supported by four limbs, two small front legs and two large hind legs. Their head had a single horn and their mouths were surrounded by tendrils which they used to eat almost anything. It was introduced to many worlds as their meat was found to be sweet, juicy, and highly nutritious.

ThingDef.label: Grank
ThingDef.description: The Grank (or 'saw-toothed grank') were a medium-sized carnivore believed to have originated on the planet Naboo. They were a species of predator/scavenger with sharp teeth and powerful jaws. Despite their fearsome gnarled appearance they were very affectionate when domesticated. This made them popular pets and lead to them establishing wild populations on multiple worlds as a result.

ThingDef.label: granite slug
ThingDef.description: The granite slug was a silica parasite native to the planet Coruscant. This small terrestrial mollusk has corrosive acidic green-gray slime blood. Its body consisted of four eyestalks, two retractable mouths, one foot, lung filaments, and suction pseudopods. One of their natural predators is the hawk-bat.

ThingDef.label: grazer
ThingDef.description: A large, slow domesticated mammalia from Alderaan that has been selectively bred to produce huge amounts of milk. Their fat reserves function to insulate them well against a broad range of temperature. However, most of them are so adapted to farm life that they cannot survive in the wild like their feral brethren.

ThingDef.label: gualaar
ThingDef.description: The Gualaar was an ungulate species indigenous to the mountains and hills of the planet Naboo. These creatures though tricky to domesticate had both the build and strength to make them perfect beasts of burden. The Royal House of Naboo kept a herd of Gualaar that were used to carry state officials. This regal affiliation and their physical practicality meant they were exported and ultimately spread across multiple worlds. It's similarity in appearance to the legendary Thrumbo is a point of interest amongst several xenobiologists.

ThingDef.label: gullipud
ThingDef.description: Gullipuds were bulky, loose-skinned, self-inflating amphibians native to the swamps of the planet Naboo. As they were small and easy prey for other animals, like pikobis, gullipuds would extend their spine to make themselves harder to catch and swallow. Due to their physical similarities to the more common gorg these creatures may have been unintentionally transported to various worlds as livestock, only to escape into the wild and establish themselves.

ThingDef.label: gundark
ThingDef.description: Gundarks were fearsome anthropoids from the planet Vanqor. They were known as one of the most vicious, strong, and aggressive species in the galaxy. This ferocity resulted in them being exported across to many worlds as gladiatorial combatants or as exotic pets. They had two powerful arms used in combat and locomotion, two smaller arms for manipulation and walked on a specialised single clawed-toes. They famously had very large ears which aided in tracking and hunting prey; typically before an ambush.

ThingDef.label: gutkurr
ThingDef.description: Gutkurrs were fierce insectile predators native to the planet Ryloth. They were aggressive and displayed very limited intelligence, however they were observed to work in small hunting packs. These traits however has made them popular game animals and "pets" for criminal organisations across the galaxy, spreading these monsterous creatures to many worlds.

ThingDef.label: harvester beetle
ThingDef.description: The harvester beetle were a large domesticated insectoid native to the planet Neimoidia, but were transplanted to all the Neimoidian purse worlds (as well as potential) worlds. They were large, herbivorous and were able to carry heavy loads on their swept backs. In the absence of their 'hive queens' pheremones, these animals have become feral but they still make excellent beasts of burden and can be milked for insect jelly.

ThingDef.label: hawk-bat
ThingDef.description: Hawk-bats were predatory reptavians with a curved beak and leathery wings that could be found on urbanized worlds like Coruscant and Taris. To get on a hawk-bat's bad side could be very dangerous. As a result, very few lived in captivity. Though they favored granite slugs, hawk-bats would feed on almost anything smaller than themselves. When they hatched from their eggs, young hawk-bats had scaly green skin and were precocial, meaning they were fully independent and able to hunt upon the day of hatching. Upon reaching maturity, the hawk-bat would shed its green skin and emerge with mature purplish-gray skin.

ThingDef.label: hssiss
ThingDef.description: Hssiss (or 'dark side dragons') were a poisnous reptile native to the planet Ambria. They were slow but aggressive ambush predators that preferred to live near bodies of water. Hssiss could be found all over the galaxy, especially on worlds where the "dark side" was strong (with most being descended from those brought by the many historical "Sith" armies).

ThingDef.label: insectomorph
ThingDef.description: Insectomorphs were insectoids from the planet Malastare. These easily domesticated omnivores were often used by the Dugs on their homeworld as battle mounts. Despite their unusual appearance they have been able to flourish as livestock on multiple worlds due to their rapid growth and hardiness.

ThingDef.label: iridonian reek
ThingDef.description: Reek could be found on the planets Iridonia, Kashyyyk, Ithor, Codian Moon, Tatooine and Saleucami (to name just a few). Various subspecies invariably sprung up as the base stock adapted to new environments. The Iridonian Reek was bred as a 'war mount' by the Iridonian Zabraks. Instead of giving them a meat diet, the Iridonian reeks were given a natural diet consisting of plant matter to keep them fierce and strong with natural vigor, which also turned a reek's skin gray. Adapted to Iridonia, their skin could resist sharp and blunt weapon attacks during battle. The Iridonian reek's horns were much sharper and longer than those of other reeks.

ThingDef.label: ithorian reek
ThingDef.description: Reek could be found on the planets Iridonia, Kashyyyk, Ithor, Codian Moon, Tatooine and Saleucami (to name just a few). Various subspecies invariably sprung up as the base stock adapted to new environments. The Ithorian Reek were used as plow animals by the Ithorians and were larger and stronger than those found on Ylesia. Their horns were also smaller because of the lack of hostility between this subspecies.

ThingDef.label: iriaz
ThingDef.description: Iriaz were docile creatures from the grassland planet Dantooine. While not normally aggressive, they could attack if provoked. They were a prey of choice for local hunters (and natural predators alike) given that they were a relatively common creature; furthering their export to many planets.

ThingDef.label: jakobeast
ThingDef.description: Jakobeasts were polar herd animals found in the tundras of icy planets in the Outer Rim. Jakobeasts were domesticated primarily for their meat, milk, and fur. While excellent livestock, they were ill-suited to serve as mounts, guards, or attack animals. . Jakobeasts were introduced by colonists that sought herd animals capable of defending themselves. As a result of the settlers' efforts, the creatures spread to hundreds of worlds, occasionally surviving long after the settlers themselves had vanished into history. Wild jakobeasts were hunted for their horns, which supposedly possess mysterious properties.

ThingDef.label: Jamel
ThingDef.description: Jamel were a slow moving reptomammal creature native to the planet Utapau. Jamels were one of the many creatures used as beasts of burden on their planet of origin and exported offworld for such purposes. Their natural resilience meant they made great livestock even in harsh environments.

ThingDef.label: kaadu
ThingDef.description: Kaadu were large, flightless reptavians that inhabited the swamps of the planets Naboo, Obredaan as well as the moon of Rori. They had sharp hearing and a keen sense of smell and adults of the species had distinct markings to distinguish gender. Kaadu were known to be fearless; consequently many were domesticated as steeds during times of conflict, or as patrol animals. This versatility made them a popular export to other worlds as both livestock and mount.

ThingDef.label: katarn
ThingDef.description: A katarn was a predatory quadruped reptomammal native to the planet Kashyyyk. Katarns had slender bodies with rodent-like tails, and narrow faces leading back to a cartilaginous ridge protecting their neck and shoulders. Katarns were creatures of great importance in the Wookiees' culture. The Wookiees, who called the katarn the "Old Prince", hunted them in their hrrtayyk ceremony. They were a popular animal for export offworld due to their ferocity.

ThingDef.label: kowakian monkey-lizard
ThingDef.description: Kowakian monkey-lizards were a bipedal reptillian primate species native to a jungle-like Outer Rim planet called Kowak. Their intelligence and cunning made them popular exports as exotic pets, with some specimens escaping and establishing wild colonies.

ThingDef.label: kinrath
ThingDef.description: Kinrath were a species of large, non-sentient arachnoids found on Dantooine, Kashyyyk, and several other planets. Kinrath had four legs and a leg-like, poisonous appendage coming out of their faces that they used to attack prey or other perceived enemies. All kinrath were blind but could sense heat which allowed them to navigate their way around and identify potential threats.

ThingDef.label: krykna
ThingDef.description: Krykna were predatory, non-sentient, spider-like creatures native to the planet Atollon. They were resistant to heat based damage and were highly tempramental, making them extremely difficult to tame.

ThingDef.label: kreetle
ThingDef.description: Kreetle were a fast breeding arthropod native to the planet Tatooine. They were was often found in cities, homes, and other urban areas and were universally considered a pest. They gave birth to young in the form of maggot-like larvae. Kreetles thrived on dead creatures, garbage and vegetable remains (including waste). They were found on many worlds having stowed away in supplies and once escaping establishing themselves in the wild.

ThingDef.label: kwazel maw
ThingDef.description: Kwazel Maw were giant aquatic slugs from the planet Rodia. They were a slow predatory creatures with remarkably tough hides that relied on ambush. Despite naturally inhabiting swamps, it appeared Kwazel Maw were equally comfortable on land. Their presence on other planets remains a mystery, although it is speculated that the eggs of these creatures may have been sold offworld as form of 'caviar' by unscrupulous rodian merchants.

ThingDef.label: Kwi
ThingDef.description: The Kwi were large, bipedal saurians native to the planet Dathomir. They were herbivorous and yet remarkably sociable and intelligent. They were believed to be the degenerated descendants of the saurian 'Kwa' race. How they arrived on the various worlds they populated is unknown; perhaps they are the long descendants of the pan-galactic 'Kwa' or maybe they are just escaped circus specimens.

ThingDef.label: kybuck
ThingDef.description: Kybucks were bipedal ungulates native to the planet Kashyyyk, and similar in appearance to the tauntauns of Hoth. These herding pack animals were fast and sociable, which made domestication and export offworld common.

ThingDef.label: lava flea
ThingDef.description: Lava fleas were large arthropods native to the planet Mustafar. As larval crystalline worms, lava fleas were able to feed on rocks. The lava flea would then continue digesting rocks and other nutrients, shedding its protective shell with time. Lava fleas were also very suitable mounts and exported as such to worlds with inhospital climates to other creatures.

ThingDef.label: leaf-tail
ThingDef.description: Leaf-tails were a small rodent species native to the planet Dagobah. A non-sentient species of winged rodent, leaf-tails had membranous leaf-like tails that aided in balance and camouflage.

ThingDef.label: longtail gorg
ThingDef.description: Longtail Gorgs, were small tailed amphibians that could be found on several planets. This subspecies was slightly larger than the usual and had a tail (hence the name) and could lay unfertilized eggs. Their spread can be attributed to this variety being a favoured snack among the Hutt species.

ThingDef.label: loth-cat
ThingDef.description: Loth-cats were a non-sentient feline species from the planet Lothal. They were small, temperamental creatures, and while at times friendly, were still able hunters with sharp teeth and claws. They were often kept as pets.

ThingDef.label: loth-wolf
ThingDef.description: Loth-wolves were a predatory canidae species from the planet Lothal with a strong historical connection to the "light side of the force". Due to their intelligence and ability to co-ordinate as a pack there is specualtion as to how "sentient" these creatures truly are. They were believed extinct by most xenobiologists, so how they got here is a mystery.

ThingDef.label: lylek
ThingDef.description: The lylek was the most dangerous predator indigenous to the planet of Ryloth. It's strange biology made it one of the few creatures able to survive in the harsh heat of the Bright Lands. These dangerous creatures were popular exotic pets with certain criminal organisations and subsequently were transported to various worlds.

ThingDef.label: maalraas
ThingDef.description: Maalraas (or 'Nighthunters') were a non-sentient species of predatory quadrupeds of unknown planetary origin. Maalraas hunted in packs, primarily preying upon cannoks and other small creatures. It is believed they used "the force" to assist in camouflaging themselves from both predator and prey. For a time they had heightened popularity with several crime syndicates as attack beasts which resulted in the species being spread to numerous worlds.

ThingDef.label: manka
ThingDef.description: Manka (or 'manka cats') were a large predatory feline species native to the planets Tython and Alderaan. Fur-covered quad-tusked quadrupeds, 'manka cats' were considered dangerous by most sentients who encountered them and were often hunted for safety reasons as well as for resources (their tusks were known to have unusual curative properties). Manka cat populations were present on numerous worlds in the Outer Rim Territories (including Kashyyyk) and some tribes have been observed domesticating these creatures as fearsome attack beasts.

ThingDef.label: massiff
ThingDef.description: Massiffs were reptilian creatures found on both Geonosis and Tatooine, although it's planet of origin is unknown. Massiffs were reptiles that had coarse skin, large jaws, toothy mouths, big dark eyes and a line of hard spikes along their backs. Canine in appearance with an armored hide, the beasts could be domesticated and used for sentry and guard tasks and were often exported to other worlds for this purpose.

ThingDef.label: mastiff phalone
ThingDef.description: Mastiff phalone were carnivorous flightless avians native to the savannas of Maridun. The mastiff phalones had turkey-like heads with a sharp beak and a mane of large brown feathers which males of the species used in courtship displays. Mastiff phalones descended from flying creatures, with their wings evolved back into powerful limbs and tended to hunt in packs of two to four. They were popular big game animals due to their speed and ferocity and were exported to various worlds for such purposes.

ThingDef.label: mastmot
ThingDef.description: Mastmots (sometimes called 'motmots') were massive, thick-furred, quadrupedal ungulates. Being herd-dwelling herbivores, they lived on the harsh, frigid world of Toola. The indigenous Whiphid people hunted the mastmots, using the body parts for food, clothing, shelter, and tools. It is from this that the animal would often find itself exported to other worlds where Whipids would or did inhabit. However the mastmots could be domesticated as tremendous beasts of burden or mighty warbeasts.

ThingDef.label: mott
ThingDef.description: Motts were medium sized, semi-aquatic herbivores native to the swamps of Naboo. They ate a wide variety of vegetation and were a primary source of food for most swamp predators. Fortunately, motts had a high reproduction rate.

ThingDef.label: Mynock
ThingDef.description: Mynocks were silicon-based parasitical organisms found across the galaxy. They were considered parasites by pilots and starport personnel. Their strange metabolism allowed them to digest various metals and components for nutritional value.

ThingDef.label: narglatch
ThingDef.description: The Narglatch was a stealthy apex predator which could be found in diverse environments, such as the swamps of Naboo or the frozen tundras of Orto Plutonia. The narglatch male had additional fleshy spikes, while females were smoother and slightly smaller. They both had non-retractable claws and a fan-like tail that acted as a rudder during high-speed chases and turns. The narglatch also had densely padded feet that made for silent footfalls.

ThingDef.label: nuna
ThingDef.description: Nuna, commonly called swamp turkeys, were reptavian gamebirds native to the planet Naboo. Nuna were diminutive bipeds, mostly covered in scaly skin and sporting a distinctive dorsal ridge. They possessed a notably prominent jutting jaw and two large wattles hanging from either side of their mouths. They were transported as livestock as well as a game animal, allowing for wild populations on other worlds.

ThingDef.label: orray
ThingDef.description: Orrays were leathery-skinned reptilian quadrupeds native to the planet Geonosis. The orray had great strength and a quick gait; making it a popular pack animal when domesticated (especially on arid worlds). The orrays used their long snouts to root for insects in time of food scarcity.

ThingDef.label: painted spat
ThingDef.description: The painted spat was an avian predator believed to have originated on the planet Talus. A mutated variant (possibly from toxic exposure), this creature was larger, stronger and more resistant than other spat subspecies.

ThingDef.label: Peko-peko
ThingDef.description: Peko-pekos were large colourful reptavians whose raucous squawks that carried over long distances. They were native to the Gungan swamps of the planet Naboo, but another breed was known to live on Nal Hutta. Their vibrant colours and vocal emulation made them popular as pets and they were exported to multiple worlds. Their skin contained a mild toxin which meant most predators ignored them (allowing for wild populations to establish themselves with ease).

ThingDef.label: pikobis
ThingDef.description: Pikobi were fast-moving, flightless reptavians which were native to the swamps of Naboo and the jungles of Onderon. Pikobis also had long, pointed beaks lined with sharp teeth that were used to spear and hold onto slippery prey which it usually swallowed in one gulp. Due to their small size they were often able to hide as stowaways aboard large cargo ships, surviving by scavenging and escaping to multiple planets.

ThingDef.label: Pufferpig
ThingDef.description: Pufferpigs were a non-sentient, herbivorous porcine species native to the planet Kyryll. Puffer pigs were occasionally bred for their meat, which was consumable by several sentient species and resulted in the animal being exported to numerous planets. The true value of a Puffer pig was it's ability to sniff out certain precious metals.

ThingDef.label: qormot
ThingDef.description: Qormots were omnivorous forest creatures from the planet Yeshocq. During the mating season their ferocity increased, usually making anyone bold (or foolish) enough to stray into Qormot territory a likely target. However, much to the dismay of the game hunters who exported these creatures to various worlds, their seasonal aggression diminished heavily when transplanted.

ThingDef.label: rikknit
ThingDef.description: The rikknit were an arboreal crustacean native to the planet New Plympto. Female rikknit had ovum sacs connected to their abdomens, which when removed via butchery were considered a delicacy. Harvested ovum sacs could also be processed into an addictive substance called ji rikknit. It is likely these creatures are escaped livestock that have since gone on to establish wild populations.

ThingDef.label: roggwart
ThingDef.description: Roggwarts were large, predatory beasts with sizeable populations on the planets Mustafar, Vendaxa, and Guiteica. These creatures were incredibly heat resistant and had an aggressive nature. Typically, only those taken from the most young of age are able to be trained as pets or guardians. Roggwarts were a favorite pet of the Kaleesh warriors and thus populations were able to establish themselves on many worlds in Wild Space as a consequence of the movements of these warrior peoples.

ThingDef.label: ronto
ThingDef.description: Ronto were large, quadruped mammals that were commonly used as beasts of burden on Tatooine. They were known for their loyalty and strength, being able to carry heavy cargo. Their tolerance to heat and relatively low food consuption made them a popular export to arid worlds as beasts of burden.

ThingDef.label: rycrit
ThingDef.description: Rycrits were hardy herd animals native to Ryloth. Twi'leks raised them for their hides, and as a source of meat (which is universally considered to be delicious). Their sharp teeth and hooves as well as their multiple nostrils were adaptations for dealing with Ryloths extreme weather and vicious predators. The cultural, culinary and practical significance of the Rycrit meant they could be found on numerous worlds as both domestic and wild stock.

ThingDef.label: runyip
ThingDef.description: Runyip or Yavin Runyip were a species of squat quadrupeds from the moon Yavin 4. The creatures had antlered heads with a flexible nose. Their coats had a characteristic pattern of black or dark brown stripes on a whitish background. It is believed this striation made them a popular game animal for export to other worlds.

ThingDef.label: Scavrats
ThingDef.description: Scavrats were large, omnivorous rodents of unknown planetary origin albeit common enough on multiple worlds that they were considered pests. They were often mistaken for the Tattooinian Womp Rat, but the big behavioural distinction here being that they were not predatory and far more sociable creatures despite their strange appearance.

ThingDef.label: scurrier
ThingDef.description: The scurrier was a rodent native to the planet Tatooine. They were fast breeding, curious omnivores that many considered a pest. The males could be distinguished from females by their curved display horns. They were known to find their way aboard docked freighters and transports, thus propagating the scurrier population across the galaxy.

ThingDef.label: shaak
ThingDef.description: Shaaks were plump pachydermoid herd animals native to the planet of Naboo. Shaaks were often raised for their meat, and had large, rotund bodies. Due to their high rate of reproduction they were often sold offworld in livestock markets.

ThingDef.label: shiro
ThingDef.description: Shiros were hard-shelled, benign, slow-moving reptiles native to the planet of Naboo. A Shiro's main defense was to retract its head, legs and tail into its spiny shell. The Shiro's low metabolism meant it could be transported over long journeys and understandably the species was spread to many worlds.

ThingDef.label: shyrack
ThingDef.description: Shyracks were large, bat-like avian creatures with razor like teeth native to the caves of the planet Korriban. While ungainly and slow-moving without eyes, Shyracks were potentially dangerous pests, especially when they converged as a flock on an opponent. It's believed these creatures were spread to various planets as "live prey" for the others beasts in Sith armies (such as the Tuk'ata).

ThingDef.label: silooth
ThingDef.description: The silooth were a large 'Sithspawn' beetle bred by the Sith Empire for use as a warbeast. Silooth were ferocious creatures using their powerful mandibles to crush their prey or tear down trees and buildings. They were spread to numerous worlds either intentionally or accidentally by the Sith. These descendents whilst not as large and ferocious (another process of feral regression in the absence of their 'Sith masters') are still formidable.

ThingDef.label: skalder
ThingDef.description: The skalder were a mammalian desert species of herbivorous quadrupeds native to the plains of the planet Florrum. They were not normally ridden by sentient beings, but were surprisingly fast if such a feat was managed. They made exceptional pack animals, even in toxic environments and so were exported by pirate bands for use offworld.

ThingDef.label: stintaril
ThingDef.description: The stintarils were a species of rapacious arboreal rodents native to the moon Yavin 4. They were predators and their prey mainly consisted of woolamanders and whisper birds, but could and would hunt other small to medium sized creatures. The metabolism of the stintaril was extremely high, and they had to eat often. It's very likely these voracious predators were introduced and established themselves as a form of pest control on several worlds.

ThingDef.label: strill
ThingDef.description: Strills were a species of highly intelligent, six-legged carnivorous mammals native to the planet Mandalore. They had folds of leathery skin between their legs which allowed them to glide short distances with sufficient updraft and they purportedly had a very distinct (often unpleasant) smell. A number of Mandalorians took to keeping strills (or 'striile' in Mando'a) as pets, making use of their naturally ferocious predatory instincts as hunting animals. This resulted in small Strill populations being found on numerous worlds where Mandalorians were or had been.

ThingDef.label: tee muss
ThingDef.description: Tee-muss were a species of domesticated farm animals native to the jungle planet Onderon. They were found on various worlds around the galaxy due to escape from domestic populations.

ThingDef.label: thranta
ThingDef.description: Thrantas were a group of flying animals originally found on the planet Alderaan. While there were multiple species and breeds varying in size and functions, most thrantas served as air transport. Populations of wild thranta were established on numerous worlds (like Bespin) where the air pollution was low.

ThingDef.label: taozin
ThingDef.description: The Taozin (also known as a 'force dragon') was a giant predatory annelid with many arms and legs native to the jungle moon of Va'art. Finding their way all over the galaxy, Taozin were thought to be extinct but this may in fact be due to their highly elusive nature. They produce an rare curiosity from their skin when butchered known as a 'Taozin nodule'.

ThingDef.label: tuk'ata
ThingDef.description: The tuk'ata (or 'Sith hounds'), were used for thousands of years to guard the tombs of the Dark Lords of the Sith on the planet Korriban. Tuk'ata were unusually intelligent and were even rumoured to communicate with one another through means unknown. It was claimed that originally the species were non-violent grazing animals before being corrupted by Sith alchemy experiments that awakened latent parts of their brain which transformed them into unnatural abominations (or 'Sithspawn'). Many small populations of these creatures were able to establish themselves on various worlds having escaped captivity from Sith armies they were indentured to.

ThingDef.label: vapaad
ThingDef.description: The vaapad, was a large predatory creature native to the world of Sarapin and its moons. Vaapads were brown ball-shaped, tripod creatures with two yellow eyes and multiple tentacles used to kill prey. A vaapad attacked by striking its prey with its toxic tentacles so quickly that they were nothing but a blur to the naked eye. They were exported offworld for use in exotic gladiatorial arenas.

ThingDef.label: varactyl
ThingDef.description: Varactyls, also known as 'dragonmounts', were reptavian herbivores native to the planet Utapau, though some specimens found their way to other worlds (such as Kashyyyk and Belsavis) as their eggs were easily transported by Black-marketeers. They had beaked faces and long, powerful tails and not only could a varactyl run very fast, but their feet were adapted with tiny hairlike structures that allowed them to climb the rocky walls of sinkholes.

ThingDef.label: veermok
ThingDef.description: Veermoks were a ferocious species of clawed and fanged primates native to the planet Naboo (but with sizeable populations on both Eriadau and Xirl). Living in swamps and moist woodlands, veermoks were arboreal creatures. They were also solitary and aggressive creatures, spending the majority of their lives without others of their kind. Their popularity amongst big game hunters meant they were exported and established on multiple worlds in the Mid and Outer Rim.

ThingDef.label: voorpak
ThingDef.description: Voorpaks were a non-sentient but still quite smart species of puffy-looking mammalians that were native to the planet of Naboo. Diminutive carnivores, voorpaks were much beloved by many due to their cuteness and as pets which in turn led to their export to many other worlds.

ThingDef.label: vornskyr
ThingDef.description: The vornskr were a pack hunting canine beast native to the forest planet Myrkr. Vornskrs were primarily nocturnal hunters, and used their whip-like, mildly venomous tails to stun prey before finishing it off with their teeth. They were popular attack beasts and pets within several criminal organisations and thus they were spread to numerous worlds as a result.

ThingDef.label: Warbird
ThingDef.description: The Warbird (or 'Sith warbird') was a species of huge flightless avian from the frigid planet Khar Delba. Sith warbirds were notorious for their bad temper and they typically used their large size to ram down their prey and gore them with their serrated beaks. After the end of the Great Sith War, Sith warbirds continued to be found throughout the galaxy, with survivors of the conflict breeding on worlds where battles had been fought by the Sith. These wild-once-more warbirds were prone to terrorizing local forms of wildlife that posed little threat to them.

ThingDef.label: whisperbird
ThingDef.description: Whisper birds were energetic avians native to the moon Yavin 4. They were known for their radiant plumage and gained their name due to their seemingly noiseless flight. They used their dexterous tongue to emit their sweet, low-pitched song or call. These traits made them popular pets with avian enthausiasts and wild populations soon appeared from escapees on numerous worlds (even on polluted worlds like Coruscant).

ThingDef.label: womp rat
ThingDef.description: Womp rats were large, omnivorous rodents native to Tatooine that were widely considered to be pests. While womp rats were opportunists and fond of carrion, they were also predators. Although their normal prey included smaller animals, such as scurriers.

ThingDef.label: woolamander
ThingDef.description: Woolamanders were curious social creatures that originated on the jungle moon of Yavin 4. They fed on fruit and other vegetation that would ferment in their pot-bellies. Colouful primate often made for exotic pets and these sociable animals were spread to multiple worlds where upon escaping wild populations soon established themselves.

ThingDef.label: worrt
ThingDef.description: The Worrt was an amphibious creature native to the planet Tatooine, though they could also be found on other worlds (including Nal Hutta and Phaeda). Worrts were omnivorous, but was also known to attempt to eat rocks and metal objects. They used their long, prehensile tongue to catch smaller prey, such as gorgs, but were known to also attack creatures larger than itself.

ThingDef.label: wraid
ThingDef.description: Wraids were large reptilian creatures found on many desert planets across the galaxy (including but not limited to Tatooine, Ruhnuk, Korriban and even Tython). They were carnivorous creatures, relying on scavening and ambush to find their prey. Wraids were often over hunted for their valuable hides, causing their populations to spike and fall.

ThingDef.label: zakkeg
ThingDef.description: Zakkegs were rare alpha-predators indigenous to the moon of Dxun. They were huge, armoured quadrupeds, typically solitary and territorial. Even Mandalorians were impressed by someone who killed one, and one could gain great honor for proving one's success. Due to this, several Mandalorian clans and big game hunters exported these creatures to numerous worlds to provide a ready supply of the beasts.

ThingDef.label: zeer
ThingDef.description: The Zeer were a species of long-necked herbivorous animals of unknown planetary origin. They were sociable herd animals. Their exotic appearance made them popular in both galactic zoological exhibits and circuses, ultimately leading to their spread to multiple worlds in order to supply demand.
